required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of PEEP=5cmH2O vs PEEP=0cmH2O PSV Strategies During SBT on Successful Disconnection From Mechanical Ventilation
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of PEEP=5cmH2O vs PEEP=0cmH2O PSV Strategies During SBT on Successful Disconnection From Mechanical Ventilation: A Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: Mechanical ventilation is the most common means of life support in intensive care unit. Daily spontaneous breathing trial (SBT) is the most effective method to evaluate whether patients on mechanical ventilation can be removed from the ventilator, thus reducing mechanical ventilation duration and ventilator-related complications. Pressure support ventilation and T-piece ventilation are the two most commonly used SBT methods, lasting from 30 minutes to 2 hours. However, the parameter setting for SBT using PSV method has not been completely agreed, especially regarding the use of positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP). Therefore, we intend to conduct a single-center, prospective, randomized, controlled study to evaluate the impact of PEEP=0cmH2O and PEEP=5cmH2O on extubation success rate and re-intubation rate in mechanically ventilated patients, to provide high-level clinical evidence on the use of PEEP for SBT in patients with mechanical ventilation, so as to reduce the duration of mechanical ventilation and complications related to mechanical ventilation.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who met the withdrawal screening criteria were randomly divided into groups for self-breathing test by PSV method with low pressure support level. Parameters of each group were as follows. In the experimental group, PS = 8 cmH2O, PEEP= 5 cmH2O, and FiO2 level was consistent with that before SBT.The control group: PSV mode, PS = 8 cmH2O, PEEP=0 cmH2O, FiO2 level was consistent with that before SBT.The duration of the spontaneous breathing test was 30 minutes, and the results of the spontaneous breathing test were evaluated at the end of the test.Endotracheal intubation was removed if the patient was successfully assessed for spontaneous breathing. Record the date and time of extubation.Patients with endotracheal intubation were treated with nasal hyperflow oxygen therapy for respiratory support.Patients with SBT failure were reconnected to the ventilator, and mechanical ventilation was given according to the ventilation mode and parameters before the spontaneous breathing test.The reasons for SBT failure were recorded and these patients were not randomized to SBT.If respiratory failure occurs within 48 hours after extubation, the attending physician decides the respiratory treatment plan.These patients were also not included in the subsequent SBT randomization.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during 48 hours after the first SBT
primary_outcome.description: The success rate of extubation (during 48 hours after the first SBT if successfully removed from the ventilator).
The reintubation rate of respiratory failure after extubation.

secondary_outcome.measure: No mechanical ventilation duration in ICU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first transfer in ICU to transfer out ICU up to 28 days after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: No mechanical ventilation duration in ICU

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to discharge from ICU up to 28 days after randomization
every 30 min during SBT up one hour to and 30min after extubation
secondary_outcome.description: PaCO2 and PaO2 (SBT screening, SBT completion, 30min after extubation)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 min during SBT up to one hour
secondary_outcome.description: lung compliance monitoring： Static and dynamic lung compliance

secondary_outcome.measure: Predictors of withdrawal of patients on mechanical ventilation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 min during SBT up one hour and before extubation

secondary_outcome.measure: Predictors of withdrawal of patients on mechanical ventilation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 min during SBT up one hour and before extubation

secondary_outcome.measure: Predictors of withdrawal of patients on mechanical ventilation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 min during SBT up to one hour and before extubation
every 15 min during SBT up to one hour and 30 min after extubation
every 15 min during SBT up to one hour and 30 min after extubation
every 15 min during SBT up to one hour and 30 min after extubation

other_outcome.time_frame: from the start to the end of SBT up to one hour and 30min after extubation
other_outcome.description: region of interests(RI),Center of Ventilation(COV),end expiratory lung inmpedance(EELI), △EELi

other_outcome.measure: Subjective score of patients with dyspnea
other_outcome.time_frame: every 30 min during SBT up to one hour and 30min after extubation
other_outcome.description: Score 0-10: 0 for no dyspnea, 10 for severe dyspnea

arm_group.description: In PSV mode,PS = 8 cmH2O,PEEP= 5 cmH2O, and FiO2 level was consistent with that before SBT
In PSV mode,PS = 8 cmH2O,PEEP=0 cmH2O, and FiO2 level was consistent with that before SBT

intervention.description: The patients who met the withdrawal screening criteria were randomly divided into low pressure support level PSV spontaneous respiration test.The duration of the spontaneous breathing test was 30 minutes, and the results of the spontaneous breathing test were evaluated at the end of the test.
